title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Indianapolis (Indianapolis, IN) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Excellent process and everyone was so nice. Beautiful campus. Indy was lovely - lots of cute neighborhoods and friendly people. Would love to work in Indy. The university process was seamless and they worked with me to identify a date that could work for the interview. The days schedule was clear and I was guided throughout the interview process.
Interview Questions: What are my research interests?

title: Help Desk Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Indianapolis (Indianapolis, IN) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy going and laid back when actually interviewing. They did not ask any technical questions that would be used to demonstrate your knowledge of the job itself.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself? What was the last thing you learned?

title: Communications and Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Indianapolis
Interview Descriptions:
I turned in my application. I was contacted the next day (both called and emailed) letting me know that the position had been open for over a month already, but that my resume intrigued them and they would like me to complete an interview project. I was given 24 hours to do this project (it was a short deadline since they were already well into the interview process). I spent a few hours completing the interview project and turned it in ahead of the deadline. I never heard anything back. No response that they received it. No "thank you for your time but we've decided to pursue another candidate". Nothing. Silence. I have since been offered (and accepted) a position elsewhere. I emailed my contact at the University of Indianapolis that I would be withdrawing my application due to accepting a position elsewhere. Again, silence. No reply.

If someone takes the time to complete a time-consuming interview project within a short time-frame, at least answer them about it. Don't waste applicants' time.
Interview Questions: Design an invite, write an admissions email, and edit/proof an article.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Indianapolis (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview for part one. Part two consisted of a panel interview with 6+ people in the room. Also had to prepare a presentation about the university to present to the interviewers.
Interview Questions: Asked what customer service means to me.

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Indianapolis (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a cover letter, curriculum vita and references on human resources online application portal; was contacted for a phone interview and invited for an on-site interview. The on-site interview consisted of meetings with the unit dean and individual faculty members, lunch with the search & screen committee, and a presentation to unit faculty.
Interview Questions: Course topics most proficient in teaching.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Indianapolis in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call from the Department Head.  He covered who he was, told me a little about the department, explained the compensation package (hourly wage and education benefits).  Said before bringing me in for an interview he wanted to talk to my current manager to get an idea of what kind of employee I would be.  I declined, as my current employer doesn't know I'm looking for another position.  I suggested that it made more sense to check references after an interview, but before an offer is made.  He called a few days later, left a voice mail that indicated they didn't want a face to face interview.
Interview Questions: Would I be willing to work for $11.83 per hour given the "great" educational benefits.

title: Vice President of Communications & Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Indianapolis
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume via the university's website for the position advertised - received an email requesting an onsite interview with the search comittee shortly thereafter.  I interviewed with the search committee (5 individuals) and then never heard from them again.  No response to any followup I submitted.
Interview Questions: Considering you have no background in an university setting - how would you get up-to-speed on how a university operates.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Indianapolis (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The position need someone to fill before new semester start so the process is fast. After the submission of Resume, an interview was arranged in a week on the Campus with the head of the department. The interview focus more on the salary, willingness to teach classes and the future development of the department.
Interview Questions: the biggest surprise is being asked about expectation for salary with the first question

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Indianapolis (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: We were shortlisted based on our resumes. A group interview was conducted for all those who were shortlisted. Specific roles were assigned based on the resume, experience and performance at the interview
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Indianapolis (Indianapolis, IN) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called, met for an informal interview, toured the campus and met several other faculty members in the Nursing School. I enjoyed touring the campus as it included several areas I would not have know I needed.
Interview Questions: What was my experience in the subject matter I was planning to teach.

title: Phone-a-thon Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Indianapolis (Indianapolis, IN) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: She had a booth set up at a job fair. After filling out the form she said to expect an email if she decided to set up an interview. I went through a phone interview and an in person interview and was offer a position at the in person interview.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a donor was cursing at you?
